doc:
Hedda Hopper https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hedda_Hopper 0 Hedda Hopper (born Elda Furry; May 2, 1885 – February 1, 1966) was an American actress and gossip columnist, notorious for feuding with her arch-rival Louella Parsons. She had been a moderately successful actress of stage and screen for years before being offered the chance to write the column Hedda Hopper's Hollywood for the Los Angeles Times in 1938. At the height of her power in the 1940s she commanded a 35 million strong readership. She was well known for her political conservatism, and during the McCarthy era she named suspected communists. Hopper continued to write gossip until the end, her work appearing in many magazines and later on radio. Hedda_Hopper ( born Elda_Furry ; May_2 , 1885 – February_1_,_1966 ) was an_American_actress_and_gossip_columnist , notorious for feuding with her_arch-rival_Louella_Parsons . She had_been a_moderately_successful_actress of stage_and_screen for years before being_offered the_chance to_write the_column Hedda_Hopper 's_Hollywood for the_Los_Angeles_Times in 1938 . At the_height of her_power in the_1940s she commanded a_35_million_strong_readership . She was_well_known for her_political_conservatism , and during the_McCarthy_era she named suspected_communists . Hopper continued_to_write gossip until the_end , her_work appearing in many_magazines and later on radio .
